questions.question: If 3x + 2y = 18 and x = 2, what is the value of y?
A tank can be filled by Pipe A in 6 hours and Pipe B in 4 hours. If both pipes are opened together, how long will it take to fill the tank?

options.text: 2.4 hours
3 hours
3.5 hours
4 hours

questions.question: Is x an even number? (1) x is divisible by 4. (2) x is divisible by 6.

options.text: Statement (1) alone is sufficient.
Statement (2) alone is sufficient.
Both statements together are sufficient.
Each statement alone is sufficient.
Statements (1) and (2) together are not sufficient.

questions.question: A certain company’s profit increased from $2 million to $2.5 million in one year. By what percent did the profit increase?
In a class of 40 students, 25 study mathematics, 20 study physics, and 10 study both. How many students study neither subject?

Although Company X’s product is more expensive than Company Y’s, customers continue to choose Company X because of its superior durability. Which of the following, if true, most strengthens the argument?

options.text: Company Y recently lowered its prices further.
The durability of a product reduces long-term replacement costs.
Company X spends more on advertising than Company Y.
Company Y introduced a new version of its product.

questions.question: Unlike many other forms of renewable energy, solar power requires no moving parts, which reduces maintenance costs and makes it attractive for remote locations.

options.text: Unlike many other forms of renewable energy, solar power requires no moving parts, which reduces maintenance costs and makes it attractive for remote locations.
Unlike many other forms of renewable energy, no moving parts are required in solar power, reducing maintenance costs and attractive for remote locations.
Solar power requires no moving parts, unlike many other forms of renewable energy, reducing maintenance costs, making attractive remote locations.
Unlike many other forms of renewable energy, solar power, requiring no moving parts, reduces maintenance costs and is attractive for remote locations.

questions.question: Passage excerpt: "In recent years, urban planners have emphasized the need for green spaces in cities, arguing that parks and gardens improve residents’ mental health and reduce air pollution." What is the primary purpose of the passage?

options.text: To criticize the expansion of green spaces in cities
To explain why green spaces are considered important in urban planning
To argue that green spaces are less effective than other urban solutions
To describe the history of urban green spaces

questions.question: If the average (arithmetic mean) of five consecutive integers is 17, what is the smallest of these integers?
A store sells pencils at 3 for $1 and pens at 2 for $1. If a customer buys 6 pencils and 4 pens, how much does the purchase cost?
